Wednesday 28th September
Dear Parents,
We are delighted to announce that the week beginning the 10th October will be Book Week at ISM and that this year the focus will be to develop and encourage an enjoyment of reading.
To begin the week we are lucky to have a visiting author from the UK. Rob Parkinson has worked with a variety of ages, from Nursery-aged children to adults running workshops, which involve telling stories with musical accompaniment. Rob has been author to a range of stories and more information can be found on his website: www.imaginaryjourneys.co.uk We are very much looking forward to working alongside him for the three days he is here.
There will be a competition running during the week for pupils of all ages to take part in. Pupils will be asked to create a front cover and blurb for an imaginary book. The title of the story will be provided. The competition will open during Monday’s assembly and will close on the Thursday of book week at 3pm.
Throughout Book Week, the children will take part in many exciting book-related activities focusing on a particular author chosen by their class teachers.
To start the week on Monday 10th October, we would love the children to come to school dressed as their favourite character from a book. Please help to support this event by arranging a suitable costume.
We will also be offering the opportunity to purchase books during the week as this was very popular last year. We will confirm the time and date of the sale before the event.
While we are unable to invite all parents to join classes during the week, if class representatives wish to see the author working with their class or Year group, please liaise with the relevant tutor regarding times.
If you have any questions related to Book Week please do not hesitate to ask.
Yours sincerely,
Miss Ruffin and Mr Frater
Literacy Coordinators
